oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Sho-|oa in general use is not found upon the flats, but in the mountains near the Orange River, and in the mountains and rivers, generally speaking, throughout the country. When dug out by the Bushmen, they replant a part of it with a small piece of the root attached; and take other roots in an old bag, hanging them up to dry opposite the house, etc. (L II.-36. 3269-3278 ,
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: About Ssho |oa: where to be found
